result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Mack Best was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: consecutive. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 6-6-2022.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
Court set restitution at zero.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Mack Best

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Mack Best in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 1 day served. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 6/6/22.

Received and filed: 
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Steven Mack Best in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Steven Mack Best in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Mack Best appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
